alert.note: Alert for Northwest Yell County; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:46AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Logan, southern Johnson, northeastern Yell and central Pope Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 646 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Knoxville, or near Clarksville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Clarksville... Paris... Dardanelle... Pottsville... Lamar... Dover... London... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Hector... Scranton... Lake Dardanelle State Park... Hoyt... Midway in Logan County... Mosley... Taral... Holman... Woodland... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 45 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
